intro: Crepidomanes humile, commonly known as the small sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the northern hemisphere. It typically thrives in moist, sandy or gravelly soils, often found in coastal areas and rocky habitats. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale pink, blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are linear and arranged in a rosette pattern, helping it conserve moisture in harsh environments. Crepidomanes humile is a member of the Montiaceae family and is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its hardy nature.
